summary: A letter from Ian Maxwell to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail. Ian Maxwell describes his close family relationship with Ghislaine, vouches for her character and innocence, and draws parallels to his own experience being acquitted in a high-profile fraud trial in the UK.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail support letter, facing criminal charges which she denies. Described by her brother as a close sibling, academically accomplished, and trustworthy.

persons.name: Ian Maxwell
persons.context: Author of the letter, Ghislaine's older brother. He provides personal testimony about her character, their relationship, and her interactions with his family, and references his own past trial experience.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over Ghislaine Maxwell's case to whom the bail support letter is addressed.

persons.name: Kevin Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as one of Ian and Ghislaine's younger siblings with whom Ghislaine was effectively brought up.

persons.name: Michael Maxwell
persons.context: The eldest brother who died at age 21 after a car crash at age 15 left him in a coma. His accident coincided with Ghislaine's birth.

connections.description: Siblings with a close, long-standing relationship. Ian describes himself as a trusted advisor to Ghislaine and vouches for her character.
Siblings who were the youngest in the family and were effectively brought up together.
Brothers, mentioned together as part of the family unit.

events.title: Ian Maxwell's Bail Support Letter
events.description: Ian Maxwell writes a letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan advocating for his sister Ghislaine Maxwell's release on bail, citing her character and his own trial experience.

events.title: Ian Maxwell's US Visit
events.description: Ian Maxwell stayed with Ghislaine Maxwell for about a week during a trip to the US.

events.title: Ian Maxwell's US Visit
events.description: Ian Maxwell stayed with Ghislaine Maxwell for about a week during a trip to the US.

events.title: Ian Maxwell's UK Fraud Trial
events.description: Ian Maxwell faced charges of conspiracy to defraud in a high-profile UK trial. He was on bail for 35 months before being unanimously acquitted.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ian Maxwell, Ghislaine's brother, wrote a letter to Judge Alison J. Nathan on December 15, 2020, supporting Ghislaine's release on bail.
Ian Maxwell states that based on knowing Ghislaine for nearly 60 years, he believes in her innocence and that she has repeatedly denied knowledge of or involvement in the criminal conduct alleged.
Ian Maxwell references his own experience being acquitted in a high-profile UK fraud trial in the mid-1990s after a 35-month wait on bail, drawing a parallel to Ghislaine's situation.
Ian Maxwell claims he is unaware of any prior allegations of criminal conduct against Ghislaine in the US or any other country before the current charges.
Ian Maxwell describes Ghislaine's early life challenges, including the death of their brother Michael and their demanding father, but notes she graduated with honors from Oxford University.
